issue.title: [WNMGDS-2530] Sketch plugin: Generate text styles from tokens
issue.body:
## Summary

Building on https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/pull/2736, this adds support for text-related tokens. The new code...
- Goes through each component's set of tokens
    - finding text tokens
    - and grouping them by the state that they represent (like "success" or "disabled")
- Converts those grouped text properties into Sketch's _shared text styles_
    - with a name that represents that component and state
    - and filling in any missing values with those from a "base" text style that [matches what our html elements would inherit](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/blob/pwolfert/sketch-tokens-update-text-styles/packages/design-system/src/styles/_reset.scss#L35-L38)
 - Resulting in a set of named groups of named text styles that can be used in individual components
    - And one of those groups is `typography`, which [corresponds to this set of typography tokens](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/blob/pwolfert/sketch-tokens-update-text-styles/packages/design-system-tokens/src/themes/core-component.ts#L437-L446)


## How to test

See previous pull request for instructions on running the plugin. New text styles will be in the text styles section of Sketch.

comment.body: Great convo in Slack today @pwolfert, I think you and @zarahzachz are on to some solid ideas for moving the needle forward on this.

commits.message: Reorganize the text style folders in sketch

issue.title: [WNMGDS-2530] Sketch plugin: Generate text styles from tokens
issue.body:
## Summary

Building on https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/pull/2736, this adds support for text-related tokens. The new code...
- Goes through each component's set of tokens
    - finding text tokens
    - and grouping them by the state that they represent (like "success" or "disabled")
- Converts those grouped text properties into Sketch's _shared text styles_
    - with a name that represents that component and state
    - and filling in any missing values with those from a "base" text style that [matches what our html elements would inherit](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/blob/pwolfert/sketch-tokens-update-text-styles/packages/design-system/src/styles/_reset.scss#L35-L38)
 - Resulting in a set of named groups of named text styles that can be used in individual components
    - And one of those groups is `typography`, which [corresponds to this set of typography tokens](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/blob/pwolfert/sketch-tokens-update-text-styles/packages/design-system-tokens/src/themes/core-component.ts#L437-L446)


## How to test

See previous pull request for instructions on running the plugin. New text styles will be in the text styles section of Sketch.

comment.body: One problem I just noticed with the `typography` text styles is that the `typography` component tokens only contain font weights and font families. The sizes come from the theme-level `font` tokens. We need to figure out a nice way of marrying the two.

[WNMGDS-2531] Fix dropdown tap-through (#2743)

* Add a temporary story to reproduce the problem

* Trying out different workarounds. This seems to work

* Clean up and explanation

The workaround I found on the Adobe Spectrum repository doesn't work all the time as-is. If you are scrolling the dropdown menu on a touch device first and then lift up your finger and tap the item under your finger, the touch event will fire on the element behind the menu. It works if you don't scroll the menu, though. My change is to remove the `once: true` part. I think it was probably added in there for to improve performance, but I'm less concerned about performance than I am about accidentally clicking things we don't mean to click!

* Remove temporary story

[NO-TICKET] Allow the setting of an error message on the inverse ChoiceList story (#2748)

Allow the setting of an error message on the inverse ChoiceList story

[NO-TICKET] Update CDN examples to use latest DS version (#2751)

* Update ds version for the web components

* Use CDN version of the web components js too!

* Update other cdn examples to use latest

[WNMGDS-2529] Give the calendar button more context for screen readers (#2749)

* Give the calendar button more context for screen readers by describing by the label and hint

* Check that the button is being described by label and hint

[WNMGDS-2525] Add an attributes table to storybook docs for web components (#2753)

* A good start to creating a table in storybook for wc attributes

* This inferred type is less specific than what we'd get from the control type

For instance, it thinks `variation` should be `string`

* Give the doc block component a real name

* Add some arg descriptions

* Don't need the "Default" col. Move the type values over and format them nicely

* Add the attributes table to the other web component stories

* Add some arg descriptions for ds-button

* Add description for ds-usa-banner's one attribute and format the config code

* Rename table again and be more clear about the accepted "boolean" values

* Apparently the other table doesn't put pipe chars between values, and it looks better

* Rename this column

* Don't need this

[WNMGDS-2521] Add custom event handling to web components (#2738)

* get WC alert unit tests passing.

* update usa banner snaps due to learns weird whitespace bug

* add tests to check for custom events on ds-button and ds-alert.

* register events on ds-button

* IT'S ALIVE! web component events work!

* add events to options, appears as a property.

* analytics events aren't firing correctly on alert/button, skipping until solution can be found.

* move case-it to design-system package json.

* move comment from analytics hook to alert tests.

* add comments to define function.

[WNMGDS-2539] Fix incompatibilities with React 18 types (#2747)

* Upgrade the react-dom types

* Get rid of unnecessary type annotations in the TS example project

* Update yarn lock

* Update the TS example so it's reporting errors

And I'm not sure what the react root error is about, but I'm silencing it for now because it's noise.

* Revert "Update the TS example so it's reporting errors"

This reverts commit 07ecee84e431087b5704bd2e4b348943ec141412.

* Didn't mean to commit this

* Try a small refactor in Table (doesn't work)

* Fix `TableCell` typing

* Apply the same type treatment to other table components

* Don't need lodash/get if we copy the `isTextField` function

* Convert Table to a function component (fixed the error)

* Convert FilterChip into a function component (fixes another error)

* Undo changes we don't want to keep

[WNMGDS-2536] Fix css-variable tables being rendered inside storybook wrapper elements (#2752)

* Fix css-variable tables being rendered inside storybook wrapper elements

My hypothesis was that this was a weird rehydration issue where the `section` element that wrapped the table for a `ComponentThemeOptions` component was similar enough to the `section` element that wraps storybook stories that Gatsby was mixing them up during rehydration. The table was getting placed in a `section.c-storybook-example__iframe-wrapper` element, which has a height of 200px, so everything that overflowed that was rendering over everything else further down on the page. All the table rows were being printed over all the guidance documentation! I think what triggered this weird behavior is that we have a bunch of conditional content inside `<ThemeContent>` blocks which remove certain elements (choose not to render them) when we're viewing certain themes. Since all the static html that needs to be rehydrated is rendered with only the core theme, this makes it difficult for Gatsby to match the two versions of the HTML—the one rendered at build time and the one rendered by the live React components.

It seems like that hypothesis was correct, because when I _hide_ the content but keep it in the DOM, the problem goes away. Note that you can only see the problem in a statically built site (`yarn build:docs && yarn serve:docs`); the problem doesn't exist in Gatsby's dev server.

* Debugging

I'm looking at the section with the id `hello-14` where in the healthcare theme it should be rendering as not hidden. In the console, it prints `👍 hello-14`, which means that it's rendering without the `hidden` attribute, and yet in the browser the element still has that attribute. It's not hydrating correctly!!!

* Revert "Debugging"

This reverts commit c331e379a20eed5053efd6289d6895a3b476b041.

* Revert "Fix css-variable tables being rendered inside storybook wrapper elements"

This reverts commit 38b12c677e5a6ebfd2d9fd86cf3af142c243fa23.

* Change the order of sections to lessen the effect of wild hydration

This doesn't fix the root issue, and it moves it around to a different element, but at least it's readable now.

In the long-term, we should probably go through our content and see if we can consolidate and get rid of the need for differences in the guidance. Sarah even had the idea to call out the differences by putting them in alerts so users understand that it’s an amendment to the core guidance.

[RELEASE] 10/19 Version bump main (#2761)

Publish

 - @cmsgov/design-system@8.0.3
 - @cmsgov/cms-design-system-docs@8.0.3
 - @cmsgov/ds-cms-gov@8.0.3
 - @cmsgov/ds-healthcare-gov@12.0.3
 - @cmsgov/ds-medicare-gov@10.0.3

* create vrts for wc badge.

* New script that does the cherry-picking for a patch release

* Add the actual cherry-picking part

* Add some instructions before kicking off the cherry-pick command

* Add some separation between the instructions and the command output

* Some more spacing

* Update README

[NO TICKET] Remove wc badge vrt, add wc badge to vrt skip list. (#2763)

remove wc badge vrt, add wc badge to vrt skip list.

[WNMGDS-2533] Write usa banner custom width docs (#2765)

write usa banner custom width docs.

[WNMGDS-2540] Fix dead links in docs (#2766)

Fix a bunch of broken links and bad info

[WNMGDS-2535] Fix interaction tests run with Preact (#2768)

* Waiting for the listbox takes us from 40 failed tests to an avg of 18

It's still not consistent, but it's better

* The tooltip failures go away when we remove the fullscreen option!

I bet that means that the resizing of the window messes with it

Note that making this same change on the dropdown tests have no effect

* Fix the dropdown interaction tests by adding some wait time 🤷

* Fix flaky Mask test by giving it the same treatment as its sibling test
Clean up old demos

pull_request.title: [WNMGDS-2530] Sketch plugin: Update swatches in place
pull_request.body:
## Summary

WNMGDS-2530

Building on https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/pull/2729, I've figured out how to update all the swatches and preserve all the assignments to the old ones in the specific layer styles of the document. For instance, if we have a designed component that is referencing the `alert__background-color` for its fill style, that fill style will get updated when we switch themes with the plugin. Previously I believed the only way we could do that was searching through all the styles in the document and finding matches, but the code I have in this branch seems to work where we're just kind of updating the swatches in place and calling some API functions to update references.

Note that my previous method of replacing the document's whole `swatches` array seemed to be part of the problem.

- Theme tokens are now built into the plugin. Whatever tokens exist when the plugin is built, those tokens will be used in the various themes. Instead of selecting json files from your filesystem when you run the plugin, you select from a list of themes.
- Token values are updated "in place" so that references from layer styles are maintained
- Updated readme

## How to test

1. Pull down this branch and switch to it
2. Open a sketch document
3. Use the plugin and choose a theme
4. Create a thing that uses one of the token colors
5. Use the plugin again to change the theme
6. It should update the colors on the thing

## Checklist

- [x] Prefixed the PR title with the [Jira ticket number](https://jira.cms.gov/projects/WNMGDS/) as `[WNMGDS-####] Title` or [NO-TICKET] if this is unticketed work.

[WNMGDS-2536] Fix css-variable tables being rendered inside storybook wrapper elements (#2752)

* Fix css-variable tables being rendered inside storybook wrapper elements

My hypothesis was that this was a weird rehydration issue where the `section` element that wrapped the table for a `ComponentThemeOptions` component was similar enough to the `section` element that wraps storybook stories that Gatsby was mixing them up during rehydration. The table was getting placed in a `section.c-storybook-example__iframe-wrapper` element, which has a height of 200px, so everything that overflowed that was rendering over everything else further down on the page. All the table rows were being printed over all the guidance documentation! I think what triggered this weird behavior is that we have a bunch of conditional content inside `<ThemeContent>` blocks which remove certain elements (choose not to render them) when we're viewing certain themes. Since all the static html that needs to be rehydrated is rendered with only the core theme, this makes it difficult for Gatsby to match the two versions of the HTML—the one rendered at build time and the one rendered by the live React components.

It seems like that hypothesis was correct, because when I _hide_ the content but keep it in the DOM, the problem goes away. Note that you can only see the problem in a statically built site (`yarn build:docs && yarn serve:docs`); the problem doesn't exist in Gatsby's dev server.

* Debugging

I'm looking at the section with the id `hello-14` where in the healthcare theme it should be rendering as not hidden. In the console, it prints `👍 hello-14`, which means that it's rendering without the `hidden` attribute, and yet in the browser the element still has that attribute. It's not hydrating correctly!!!

* Revert "Debugging"

This reverts commit c331e379a20eed5053efd6289d6895a3b476b041.

* Revert "Fix css-variable tables being rendered inside storybook wrapper elements"

This reverts commit 38b12c677e5a6ebfd2d9fd86cf3af142c243fa23.

* Change the order of sections to lessen the effect of wild hydration

This doesn't fix the root issue, and it moves it around to a different element, but at least it's readable now.

In the long-term, we should probably go through our content and see if we can consolidate and get rid of the need for differences in the guidance. Sarah even had the idea to call out the differences by putting them in alerts so users understand that it’s an amendment to the core guidance.

 - @cmsgov/ds-healthcare-gov@12.0.3
 - @cmsgov/ds-medicare-gov@10.0.3

[WNMGDS-2532] Web component documentation (#2760)

* create badge story, add description to all wc stories.

* update SeeStorybookForReactGuidance to be more agnostic and allow specification of tech

* update to use new SeeStorybookForGuidance component, update Style/Customization heading to Style customization

* update main storybook link for label.

* create vrts for wc badge.

[NO-TICKET] Add a "patch" script for automatically cherry-picking commits (#2762)

* New script that does the cherry-picking for a patch release

* Add the actual cherry-picking part

* Add some instructions before kicking off the cherry-pick command

* Add some separation between the instructions and the command output

* Some more spacing

* Update README

[NO TICKET] Remove wc badge vrt, add wc badge to vrt skip list. (#2763)

remove wc badge vrt, add wc badge to vrt skip list.

[WNMGDS-2533] Write usa banner custom width docs (#2765)

write usa banner custom width docs.

[WNMGDS-2540] Fix dead links in docs (#2766)

Fix a bunch of broken links and bad info

[WNMGDS-2535] Fix interaction tests run with Preact (#2768)

* Waiting for the listbox takes us from 40 failed tests to an avg of 18

It's still not consistent, but it's better

* The tooltip failures go away when we remove the fullscreen option!

I bet that means that the resizing of the window messes with it

Note that making this same change on the dropdown tests have no effect

* Fix the dropdown interaction tests by adding some wait time 🤷

* Fix flaky Mask test by giving it the same treatment as its sibling test

[WNMGDS-2535] Make storybook use Preact by default (#2769)

Make storybook use Preact by default unless explicitly told not to

[WNMGDS-2542] Fix radio example showing on checkbox doc page (#2767)

Fix radio example showing on checkbox doc page

[WNMGDS-2530] Sketch plugin: Update swatches in place (#2736)

* Add support for getting colors from components files as well

* Instead of replacing all swatches, selectively replace updated ones and add new ones

* Embed the token data in the sketch plugin and select theme from list instead of filesystem

Also updated the naming of the exported json tokens to not all be prefixed with "theme"

* [NO-TICKET] Expand token support in the sketch plugin to component colors (#2729)

* Add support for getting colors from components files as well

* Instead of replacing all swatches, selectively replace updated ones and add new ones

* Updates the swatches in place and updates references, but it only works once

Here's how I'm testing: I have a rectangle whose fill references the alert background token and whose border color references the alert border color token. When I switch themes, the rectangle changes colors. However, it only works once. I think this might have to do with changes not being saved

* If I also search and replace, it updates swatch references every time

However, if I only search and replace and do not use `updateWithColor` and `updateReferencesToSwatch` but simply replace the swatch in my swatch map with a new swatch, it does not work

* Cleaning up and organizing

Trying to figure out why this code works. It throws errors, and yet the loop for updating swatches in the layer styles is necessary for everything to work

* Found that the error keeps the rest of the function from executing

The error we get from `style.fillType === Swatch` causes the rest of the function not to execute. Apparently this only works if we don't update the `doc.swatches`!

* Determined that calls to `sketch.Swatch.from` do not automatically add to doc

It had appeared that way in my last commit, but I think the reason why I couldn't just replace the array of swatches with one generated from `Object.values(swatchMap)` was that Sketch was losing all its references to the swatches that I had mutated through `updateWithColor` when I replaced the array with a new instance. I don't know why that would happen, but my code seems to work if I don't reassign the whole array and instead use `.push` to add my new swatches if they're new

* Update plugin readme

pull_request.title: [WNMGDS-2530] Sketch plugin: Update swatches in place
pull_request.body:
## Summary

WNMGDS-2530

Building on https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/pull/2729, I've figured out how to update all the swatches and preserve all the assignments to the old ones in the specific layer styles of the document. For instance, if we have a designed component that is referencing the `alert__background-color` for its fill style, that fill style will get updated when we switch themes with the plugin. Previously I believed the only way we could do that was searching through all the styles in the document and finding matches, but the code I have in this branch seems to work where we're just kind of updating the swatches in place and calling some API functions to update references.

Note that my previous method of replacing the document's whole `swatches` array seemed to be part of the problem.

- Theme tokens are now built into the plugin. Whatever tokens exist when the plugin is built, those tokens will be used in the various themes. Instead of selecting json files from your filesystem when you run the plugin, you select from a list of themes.
- Token values are updated "in place" so that references from layer styles are maintained
- Updated readme

## How to test

1. Pull down this branch and switch to it
2. Open a sketch document
3. Use the plugin and choose a theme
4. Create a thing that uses one of the token colors
5. Use the plugin again to change the theme
6. It should update the colors on the thing

## Checklist

- [x] Prefixed the PR title with the [Jira ticket number](https://jira.cms.gov/projects/WNMGDS/) as `[WNMGDS-####] Title` or [NO-TICKET] if this is unticketed work.

pull_request.title: [WNMGDS-2542] Fix radio example showing on checkbox doc page
pull_request.body:
## Summary

The [Checkbox](https://design.cms.gov/components/checkbox/) page on the doc site was showing radio buttons for one of its examples. This fixes it so that the example is of checkboxes.

## How to test

1. `yarn start`
2. Go to http://localhost:8000/components/checkbox/
3. Take a look at the "checkbox children"

## Checklist

- [x] Prefixed the PR title with the [Jira ticket number](https://jira.cms.gov/projects/WNMGDS/) as `[WNMGDS-####] Title` or [NO-TICKET] if this is unticketed work.
- [x] Selected appropriate `Type` (only one) label for this PR, if it is a breaking change, label should only be `Type: Breaking`
- [x] Selected appropriate `Impacts`, multiple can be selected.
- [x] Selected appropriate release milestone

issue.title: Spinner does not cover Dialog
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When a Dialog component initiates an action that requires a Spinner component to appear, such as a remote data loading action, the Spinner does not cover the Dialog and the Dialog remains active to the user. This is because HTML dialog elements live in their own layer above all the page content. 

It's possible to fix this by using a dialog element for the spinner, because a newly opened dialog covers any that are currently open. I've created a minimal JS/CSS/HTML to demonstrate the issue which makes it easier to reproduce with basic markup than trying to pull in all of React and CMSDS components. It still needs some a11y work so it's not finished.

[dialog-demo.html.txt](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/files/13116035/dialog-demo.html.txt)

**To Reproduce**
1) Rename the demo file to .html and load in the browser.
2) Click the Open dialog button. The dialog should appear in the center of the screen.
3) Click the Show dialog spinner button. The spinner should cover the dialog and the rest of the page is inert. Click the spinner to close it.
4) With the dialog still open, click the Show normal spinner. The dialog will stay on top of the spinner and remain active, but the rest of the page is inert.
5) Click the Close button on the dialog. Note the spinner was present behind the dialog. Click the spinner to close it.

**Expected behavior**
The Spinner should cover and inactivate the Dialog when it appears.

**Screenshots**
![Screen Shot 2023-10-24 at 10 11 40 AM](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/assets/40182224/8541a281-e21b-47b1-8963-6e983e4e870d)
Dialog open, no spinner

![Screen Shot 2023-10-24 at 10 11 52 AM](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/assets/40182224/a6a38f89-79ec-4759-b0f0-ef697dfbff87)
Dialog open, dialog-based spinner

![Screen Shot 2023-10-24 at 10 12 14 AM](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/assets/40182224/9fe1b2f2-a118-4386-8d2a-2129c41c82a5)
Dialog open, standard spinner

![Screen Shot 2023-10-24 at 10 16 33 AM](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/assets/40182224/cb88f40b-5a0e-4ec9-a171-3b00c682e37a)
Dialog closed, standard spinner

**Additional context**
References:
* [`dialog` on MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dialog)
* CMSDS Spinner - [JS](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/blob/main/packages/design-system/src/components/Spinner/Spinner.tsx), [CSS](https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/blob/main/packages/design-system/src/styles/components/_Spinner.scss)

comment.body: Reviewing the use cases for the current Spinner, it made sense to me why it wouldn't show over a Dialog. So I'm good with that. Thanks!

commits.message:
[WNMGDS-2535] Make storybook use Preact by default (#2769)

Make storybook use Preact by default unless explicitly told not to

pull_request.title: [WNMGDS-2535] Make storybook use Preact by default
pull_request.body:
## Summary

WNMGDS-2535

Follows up https://github.com/CMSgov/design-system/pull/2768

- Change how we evaluate the `PREACT` environment variable in Storybook so that we assume we're using Preact unless that environment variable is explicitly set to something falsey. That means `yarn storybook` will use Preact by default, and the statically built versions will too as well.
- Replaced `yarn storybook:preact` with `yarn storybook:react` that runs it in React mode instead of Preact

## How to test

1. `yarn storybook` and make sure the web component stories work
2. `yarn storybook:react` and see that they don't
3. `yarn build:storybook` and serve the `storybook-static` directory from a web server like `http-server ./storybook-static` and make sure the web component stories work

## Checklist

- [x] Prefixed the PR title with the [Jira ticket number](https://jira.cms.gov/projects/WNMGDS/) as `[WNMGDS-####] Title` or [NO-TICKET] if this is unticketed work.
- [x] Selected appropriate `Type` (only one) label for this PR, if it is a breaking change, label should only be `Type: Breaking`
- [x] Selected appropriate `Impacts`, multiple can be selected.
- [x] Selected appropriate release milestone
